item.title: Cannabis Commonly Used as a Sleep Aid Among Young Adults
item.description: Experts warn doing so may worsen sleep quality and raise the risk for substance abuse over time. Medscape Medical News

item.title: FDA Approves Third-Ever Drug for Lupus Nephritis
item.description: Obinutuzumab (Gazyva) is the first drug to be approved for lupus nephritis since the approvals of belimumab (Benlysta) in 2020 and voclosporin (Lupkyn...

item.title: EV + Pembro Beats SOC in Cisplatin-Ineligible Bladder Cancer
item.description: Muscle-invasive bladder cancer patients who are ineligible or refuse cisplatin chemotherapy see “dramatic” improvements in survival outcomes with enfo...

item.title: Narcolepsy and Mortality Risk: New Data
item.description: Narcolepsy is not associated with increased risk for mortality of any type, even among patients with a higher prevalence of psychiatric comorbidities,...

item.title: Warning Signs a Hospital Patient Is Lonely or Afraid
item.description: Recognizing isolation or fear in a patient is important for hospitalists and may require a little more time with the patient. Medscape Medical News
